Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the idea that workers living in the U.S. illegally are the only ones willing to do the job at chicken processing plants.
Falters at times: The claim falters when it suggests that no one else will do the job, ignoring evidence that there is demand for these jobs.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that workers living in the U.S. illegally are the only ones willing to do the job.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that workers living in the U.S. illegally are the only ones who can or will do the job at chicken processing plants.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for why workers living in the U.S. illegally are employed in chicken processing plants, such as low wages and poor working conditions.
